H0.text: Cytoplasm is where DNA is located in prokaryotic cells.

H1.text: Ribosomes are where DNA is located in prokaryotic cells.

H2.text: Cytoskeleton is where DNA is located in prokaryotic cells.

H3.text: Mitochondria are not where DNA is located in prokaryotic cells.

A4.text: The genome in a prokaryote is held within a DNA/protein complex in the cytosol called the nucleoid, which lacks a nuclear envelope.

A5.text: Prokaryotes lack mitochondria. Instead, processes such as oxidative phosphorylation and photosynthesis take place across the prokaryotic cell membrane.

A6.text: The nucleoid is located within the prokaryotic cell and contains the genetic material.

A7.text: Prokaryotes lack mitochondria, which are not present in prokaryotic cells.
